intro: Coffea abeokutae var. microcarpa, commonly known as the Kookoobee coffee. This variety is native to the highlands of Ethiopia, where it thrives in tropical climates with high humidity and well-drained soils. It is characterized by its small, red berries and a unique flavor profile that includes notes of citrus and spice. The plant is a shrub or small tree, typically reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species within its native range.
